title.en: Estonian for Beginners I (100% Web-Based). Level 0 - A1.1
title.et: Eesti keel algtasemele I (100% e-õpe), tase 0 - A1.1

faculty.address:

name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

description.en:
The chapters of the course:
1. Hello, let's get acquainted!
2. Tell me about your family
3. My day
4. Food and drinks
5. Free time 
6. Estonia
description.et:
Kursuse teemad:
1. Tere! Saame tuttavaks!
2. Räägi mulle oma perest.
3. Minu päev.
4. Söögid ja joogid.
5. Vaba aeg
6. Eesti

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to get the basic knowlege of Estonian through different themes and excersises.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda algteadmisi eesti keelest erinevate teemade ja harjutuste kaudu.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, the student:
- can use the basic vocabulary and grammar for the level A1.1;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kasutada A1.1 taseme vastavat baassõnavara ja grammatilisi vorme;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to participate in the simple daily conversations;
learning_outcomes.et: - saab hakkama lihtsamates suhtlussituatsioonides tänaval, poes, söögikohtades, seltskonnas;

learning_outcomes.en: - can talk and write about her/himself, about, her/his day, family and hobbies.
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab rääkida ja  kirjutada endast, oma kodust, perekonnast ja hobidest.

grade_evaluation.et:
The grading of the course is only partially automatic.

The tests and exercises are graded automatically by Moodle in points.

The lecturer will grade and give feedback for the writing tasks within three weeks after the deadline. The writing tasks must be written based on the study material of the course (it is not allowed to use AI when writing the texts).

There are three tests in total, one after every four weeks. The exercises must be completed BEFORE the tests. By the end of the course all the exercises in Moodle must be completed.

You can get in a total of 80 points for the course:
1. Writing task - Write about yourself -  5 points
2. Writing task - My Family - 5 points
3. Writing taskEssay - My Day - 5 points
4. Writing task - Write down your shopping list for a week - 5 points
5. Writing task - Write about your food preferences -  5 points

Note the deadlines of the writing tasks and the Moodle exercises!
TESTS:

I Test - 10 points
II Test - 10 points
III Test - 10 points


For doing all the exercises - 25 points

One minus point for EVERY uncompleted exercises (less than 50% of the answers are correct), if there are more than 25 exercises uncompleted, then one will not get points for exercises. If more than 50 exercises are not completed before the deadline (less than 50% of the answers are correct) then the student can not pass this course. Please note the deadline of the exercises.

NB! To get to the final grading, ALL the writing tasks and tests have to be completed on time and for the result more than 50% of the maximum (at least 2,5  points for the essay and 5 points for test)! 

The final grading in percentages from the total points (80)
90-100% - "A"
80-89% - "B"
70-79% - "C"
60-69% - "D"
50-59% - "E"
Less than 50% - "F"

debt_elimination.et: There will be certain date provided in the end of semester to retake the tests (in the computer class).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
